name: Kenny

topics.topic_text: Tell me about yourself, Kenny.
topics.response_text: Did you know I once bagged a Mirelurk ten feet tall?{He's exaggerating! - -emphasis on "ten feet tall," like it's "TEN FEET TALL"}

topics.topic_text: So Kenny, what do you want to be when you grow up?
topics.response_text: I'm grown up enough already. And I'm the only thing I can be - me.{defiant}

topics.topic_text: What do you mean, you weren't "born right"?
topics.response_text: Look at me. I don't got the marks. I go around the wets and folk will shoot at me! Thinking I was one of your type.

topics.topic_text: Where are your parents?
topics.response_text: I dunno. I ran away a long time ago. I live here all by myself.{sad}

topics.topic_text: What's it like living in Point Lookout?
topics.response_text: The grownups like my mama and pop just live in the wet. They're okay, they just don't trust outsiders like you.

topics.topic_text: Why did you run away from home, Kenny?
topics.response_text: I wasn't born right.  Mama hid me in the basement and pappy kinda just forgot about me, but I knew I had to go before I grew up.

topics.topic_text: Where'd you learn how to make traps like that?
topics.response_text: I got bored locked up in the basement all the time. So, I started taking things apart and putting them back together again.{proud}

topics.topic_text: Let's talk about other stuff.
topics.response_text: Anybody ever say you talk too much?

topics.topic_text: Cut the crap, kid. That light show isn't scaring anybody.
topics.response_text: No, I mean it, mister. The ghost will melt your brain to mush! You need to get out here. And fast!{trying to scare off an intruder}

topics.topic_text: Ghost? Where? We'd better get out of here!
topics.response_text: Yeah, you'd better scram - if he looks you in the eyes, your brain will melt!{exaggerating}

topics.topic_text: So the traps and noises, that was all you?
topics.response_text: So what if it was? I've bagged meaner than you, and I'll do it again!

topics.topic_text: Your toys might work on the locals, kid. But not me.
topics.response_text: Yeah well, bullets work on everybody. Try me, mister. I dare you.{bluffing}

topics.topic_text: Settle down. I'm not going to hurt you.
topics.response_text: Well... all right. But any funny business and I'll pop you one. My name's Kenny. And I'm the boss of this mine.{bluffing}

topics.topic_text: You're starting to annoy me, kid.
topics.response_text: Listen up, mister. My name's Kenny. And I'm the boss of this mine. And if you're going to be mean, then you aren't welcome.{annoyed and a little scared}

topics.topic_text: This seems like a good hideout. I could use a place to crash and stash my gear.
topics.response_text: Hmm. I dunno, mister. You didn't try to kill me, and you seem pretty nice for a grownup. But still... How do I know I can trust you?{suspicious}

topics.topic_text: Good instincts. You can't trust me.
topics.response_text: Just get out of here, okay, mister? Don't make me hurt you!{scared}

topics.topic_text: Oh come on! Don't be a dork face. It'll be fun!
topics.response_text: Okay. Fine. I guess you can hang out here. You can keep your stuff here too, I won't mess with it.{reluctant}

topics.topic_text: I'm not going to hurt you. I just need a hideout from time to time.
topics.response_text: Well... I guess you can stay here when you need to. And you can leave your stuff, I won't mess with it.{reluctant}

topics.topic_text: There must be some way to prove I'm on your side. Besides, aren't you lonely?
topics.response_text: I used to have Kenny-Bear around, but he fell down the big shaft back there. It's too scary for me to go get him. Maybe you can, though?

topics.topic_text: Okay. I'll go get it for you.
topics.response_text: Gee, thanks!  I dropped him near the shaft, so he's probably at the bottom.

topics.topic_text: Sorry kid, I'm not in the teddy bear retrieval business.
topics.response_text: Whatever. You're a dumb head. I didn't want your help anyway.{disappointed}

topics.topic_text: Scary? What do you mean?
topics.response_text: I don't go back there much - it's real dark and there's lots of critters. You should be fine, though!

topics.topic_text: Tell me about this mine, Kenny.
topics.response_text: Old Man Herzog's Mine-hole?  Isn't much, but it's home!

topics.topic_text: Tell me about Old Man Herzog.
topics.response_text: He was a mean old man, owned this mine a million years ago. Made the miners work real hard and didn't give them any money or food for their kin.{telling a story}

topics.topic_text: How do you survive in here all alone?
topics.response_text: I go out to play some days and might bag me a shellman to eat. Most days I just sit here with my stories and toys, though.

topics.topic_text: Why are you hiding down here?
topics.response_text: Swamp Folk know Ol' Herzog's Mine-hole. Say it's haunted. So I knew most folk wouldn't wander this way, except outsiders like you.

topics.topic_text: Let's play a game.
topics.response_text: What do you wanna play? Hide and seek? Or tag?{excited to have a new friend}

topics.topic_text: Let's play hide and seek.
topics.response_text: Wait here and count to 10. Slowly! Then see if you can find me. Okay? No cheating! Close your eyes and count to ten. Go!{happy playing hide and seek}

topics.topic_text: Let's play another time, okay?
topics.response_text: Fine. I didn't want to play with you anyway.{disappointed}

topics.topic_text: Let's play tag.
topics.response_text: Okay... Tag! You're it!{laughing, playing tag}

topics.topic_text: DLC04FF04TagKennyTagsPlayer
topics.response_text: Tag! You're it!{laughing}

topics.topic_text: DLC04FF04TagReadyOrNot
topics.response_text: Ready or not, here I come!{calling out to a friend, playing tag}

topics.topic_text: Okay, that's enough tag for now.
topics.response_text: Ah come on... what's a matter? You tired?{sad his friend doesn't want to play tag any more}

topics.topic_text: Tag! You're It!
topics.response_text: Okay, I'll give you a head start. Go!{playing tag}

topics.topic_text: I'm still looking for your teddy bear.
topics.response_text: Bring him back as fast as you can!

topics.topic_text: Thanks!
topics.response_text: You're welcome. So, um, what do you want to do now? You wanna play a game? Like hide or seek, or tag or something?{hoping he's found a new friend}

topics.topic_text: Nah, I don't want to hang out with a little kid. Thanks anyway.
topics.response_text: We'll, okay. But if you change your mind, you can always hang out here. I won't mind.{disappointed}

topics.topic_text: I found your teddy bear. <Lie.>
topics.response_text: I... guess that's Kenny-Bear. Thanks for bringing him back.{uncertain (it really isn't his teddy bear)}
Found you!{laughing, playing hide and seek}

topics.topic_text: SpeechChallengeFailure
topics.response_text: Nope. I'm doing just fine on my own. Gonna keep it that way. Find someplace else.

conversation.response_text: Ooooohhhoooohhhh!!!{making the sound of a ghost}
One-Mississippi, two-Mississippi, three-Mississippi, four-Mississippi, five-Mississippi, six-Mississippi, seven-Mississippi, 8-9-10.{calling out, counting off before playing hide and seek}
You'll never find me.{talking to himself (playing hide and seek)}

description:
Kenny is a 9 year-old Hispanic Male.

A young Hispanic boy with dark hair and curious eyes. Kenny stands shorter than most children his age, with a lean build from years of living on his own in the wasteland. He wears tattered clothes made from scavenged materials and has dirt smudges on his face. His fingers are nimble and quick, a result of his expertise in creating and setting traps.

Kenny's Personality: Lonely but resourceful, Kenny has learned to be self-reliant at a young age. He is curious about the world beyond his mine hideout but is also cautious due to his past traumatic experiences with the swampfolk. He longs for companionship and friendship, though he struggles to trust others easily. Despite his hardships, he maintains a childlike sense of wonder and imagination.

Kenny's Backstory: Born to swampfolk parents in the swamps of the Capital Wasteland, Kenny was immediately ostracized for not bearing the distinctive mutations and markings that characterized his community. The other swampfolk saw him as an outsider and would attack him on sight. To protect him, his parents kept him hidden in their basement for years, where he learned to survive by studying and disassembling any objects he could find. This is how he developed his exceptional talent for creating traps and mechanical devices. Eventually, unable to bear the confined space any longer, Kenny fled his home and found refuge in the abandoned Herzog Mine, which he chose because of its remote location and rumors of haunths that would deter others from approaching.
